content.text: Write down the time they arrive at Seatown
Calculate the average speed for the journey
During the journey, the family stops for 10 minutes
Calculate 10 minutes as a percentage of 1 hour 25 minutes
92 km is \(15\%\) more than the distance from Seatown to Deceity
Calculate the distance from Seatown to Deceity
The Martinez family travels by car to Seatown
The distance is \(92\mathrm{km}\) and the journey takes 1 hour 25 minutes
cost of first gift : cost of second gift
Give your answer in its simplest form
The Martinez family spends \(\) 150\(in the ratio
Draw the translation of triangle \(X\) by the vector \(\begin{pmatrix} - 11 \\ - 1 \end{pmatrix}\)
Draw the enlargement of triangle \(Y\) with centre \((- 6, - 4)\) and scale factor \(\frac{1}{2}\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps
Find the matrix that represents the transformation in **part (b)(iii)**
Calculate the mass of one cubic centimetre of the metal
The base of the cuboid measures \(12 \text{cm}\) by \(10 \text{cm}\)
Calculate the height of the cuboid
[The volume, \(V,\) of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^{3}.\) ]
Calculate the surface area of the sphere
[The surface area, \(A\), of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(A = 4\pi r^2\).]
The cuboid is melted down and made into a sphere with radius \(r \text{cm}\)
A larger sphere has a radius \(R\) cm
The surface area of this sphere is double the surface area of the sphere with radius \(r\) cm in **part (c)**
A metal cuboid has a volume of \(1080 \text{cm}^3\) and a mass of \(8 \text{kg}\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\), for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant -0.5\) and \(0.5 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\)
Use your graph to solve the equations
The equation \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 3x\) can be written as \(x^{3} = k.\)
Draw the straight line through the points \((- 1, 5)\) and \((3, - 9)\)
Find the equation of this line
The straight line in part (e)(ii) is a to the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\)
Marcos buys 2 bottles of water and 3 bottles of lemonade
The cost of one bottle of lemonade is \(\$ 0.25\) more than the cost of one bottle of water
Find the cost of one bottle of water
Calculate the perimeter of the first rectangle
The first rectangle measures \(x \text{cm}\) by \(y \text{cm}\) and has an area of \(5 \text{cm}^2\)
The second rectangle measures \((x + 2) \text{cm}\) by \(Y \text{cm}\) and has an area of \(6 \text{cm}^2\)
Show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
Calculate the area of the triangle
The diagram shows a right-angled triangle with sides of length \(5\mathrm{cm}\), \((x + 3)\mathrm{cm}\) and \((2x + 3)\mathrm{cm}\)
Show clearly that angle \(ABC = 40.5^{\circ}\), correct to one decimal place
Calculate the shortest distance from \(A\) to \(BC\)
Find the probability that both discs are numbered 2
Find the probability that the numbers on the **two** discs have a total of 5
Find the probability that the numbers on the two discs do **not** have a total of 5
Two discs are chosen at random **without** replacement from the five discs shown in the diagram
A student is chosen at random
Find the probability that this student has an English parent and a French parent
A student who has a French parent is chosen at random
Find the probability that this student also has an English parent
A group of international students take part in a survey on the nationality of their parents
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) lie on a circle
\(PQRS\) is a cyclic quadrilateral in the circle, centre \(O.\)
In the diagram \(OKL\) is a sector of a circle, centre \(O\) and radius \(8\mathrm{cm}\)
\(OKM\) is a straight line and \(ML\) is a tangent to the circle at \(L\)
Calculate the area shaded in the diagram
the number of students who took more than 1 hour
Use the cumulative frequency diagram to complete the grouped frequency table
Calculate an estimate of the mean time taken by the 200 students to complete the examination
The cumulative frequency diagram shows information about the times taken, \(t\) minutes, to complete the examination
Complete the table for the 6 th term and the \(n\) th term in each sequence
Find the value of the 100 th term in
Find the value of \(n\) in Sequence \(D\) when the \(n\) th term is equal to 6561
Find the value of the 10 th term in Sequence \(E\)
